channel.title: I am making a server and
channel.description: well...I have made one before and i was playing on my server and then like my cmd that it goes thru just stopped working the next day like i had players on everything now when i try to open it or any cmd or even just my command prompt it says the command prompt has been disabled by an administrator any ideas?

item.title: I am making a server and
item.dc:creator: @mursanari mursanari
item.description:
@mursanari wrote:

google “how to unblock cmd via Regedit windows 7” something like that…

Read full topic

item.title: I am making a server and
item.dc:creator: @preepsha3 preepsha3
item.description:
@preepsha3 wrote:

[quote=“justinxg27, post:6, topic:379212”]how don’t u understand this dude…
Click Start, Run and type this command exactly as given below: (better - Copy and paste)
REG add HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System /v DisableCMD /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f[/quote]I get what ur saying but I have windows 7 not vista so i dont have the run thing so i just searched it and it showed nothing

Read full topic

I am making a server and, We dont give a shit.
[/quote]:’([/quote]
this goes in the help section not server downloads, this is a good way to get yourself muted.

item.title: I am making a server and
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

how don’t u understand this dude…
Click Start, Run and type this command exactly as given below: (better - Copy and paste)
REG add HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System /v DisableCMD /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f

item.source: I am making a server and

item.title: I am making a server and
item.dc:creator: @preepsha3 preepsha3
item.description:
@preepsha3 wrote:

[quote=“justinxg27, post:2, topic:379212”]Method 1: Using the console registry tool

Click Start, Run and type this command exactly as given below: (better - Copy and paste)
REG add HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System /v DisableCMD /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f

Method 2: Edit the registry directly

Open Registry Editor (Regedit.exe) and navigate to:

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System]

In the right-pane, double-click DisableCMD and set it’s data to 0[/quote]kk thanks for the help but i dont understnad i would be very happy if u have teamviewer and could help me out

Read full topic
item.source: I am making a server and

item.title: I am making a server and
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

Method 1: Using the console registry tool

Click Start, Run and type this command exactly as given below: (better - Copy and paste)
REG add HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System /v DisableCMD /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f

Method 2: Edit the registry directly

Open Registry Editor (Regedit.exe) and navigate to:

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System]

In the right-pane, double-click DisableCMD and set it’s data to 0

Read full topic
